info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:11AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark County through 1145 AM MDT... At 1110 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Augusta to 18 miles north of Wolf Creek. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding possible. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Bowmans Corner, Nilan Reservoir and Bean Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
